noun.description: An object or group of objects wrapped in paper or plastic, or packed in a box.
A set of proposals or terms offered or agreed as a whole.
A collection of programs or subroutines with related functionality.

verb.description: Put into a box or wrapping, especially for sale.
examples: choose products that are packaged in recyclable materials

verb.description: Present (someone or something) in a particular way, especially to make them more attractive.

origin: Mid 16th century (as a noun denoting the action or mode of packing goods): from the verb pack + -age; compare with Anglo-Latin paccagium. The verb dates from the 1920s.
